arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifier of the KX volume.

availabilityZones.description:
The identifier of the AWS Availability Zone IDs.

The following arguments are optional:

azMode.description: The number of availability zones you want to assign per volume. Currently, Finspace only support SINGLE for volumes.

createdTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which the volume was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

environmentId.description: A unique identifier for the kdb environment, whose clusters can attach to the volume.

lastModifiedTimestamp.description: Last timestamp at which the volume was updated in FinSpace. Value determined as epoch time in seconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000.

name.description: Unique name for the volumr that you want to create.

nas1Configurations.description: Specifies the configuration for the Network attached storage (`NAS_1`) file system volume. This parameter is required when `volume_type` is `NAS_1`. See `nas1_configuration` Argument Reference below.

statusReason.description: The error message when a failed state occurs.

tags.description: A list of key-value pairs to label the volume. You can add up to 50 tags to a volume

type.description: The type of file system volume. Currently, FinSpace only supports the `NAS_1` volume type. When you select the `NAS_1` volume type, you must also provide `nas1_configuration`.
